title: Joust 2026 - 24 Hour Relay (4-6 September)
description:
Placeholder for interested Buzzards to join relay teams, pairs and even go solo 

Jack Young leading coordination for this  There is a WhatsApp group in the Buzzard Community for this too.

title: HBXC Winter XC: Race #5
description:
Race 5 of the Winter XC series will be hosted by Hereford Tri Club.

Route will be approx. 10km (6 miles) over varying terrain.

Get clicked in if you want to race and keep an eye on strava / whatsapp for more information in future.

title: HBXC Winter XC: Race #4
description:
Winter XC race #4: Malvern College.

Route will be approx. 10km (6 miles) over varying terrain (mainly off road). Event is open to people of all abilities to compete for the club.

This is an event for those wishing to compete in the 4th race of this year's winter XC series taking place from Malvern College. This promises to be a good event, and maximum turn out would be amazing as we are hositng this race.

More information to follow.
location: Malvern College, College Rd, Malvern, WR14 3DF, United Kingdom

title: Buzzard Cross Country Hosting - VOLUNTEERS (NOT A RUN)
description:
This is a Strava event for volunteers to help marshal and take on other tasks as the Club hosts a race in the Herefordshire and Borders XC league.  You will allocated a role nearer the time but please hold the date.

If you want to me more involved then see the Strava post or drop a note or message to Sim Buzzard [Phone Number Redacted].
location: Malvern College Playing Fields, Malvern, WR14 3ED, United Kingdom

title: * League event* Telford 10k
description:
A new addition to this yearâ€™s league and apparently statistically proven as the fastest 10k course in the UK, for those looking for a PB. This is a generally flat 2 lap traffic free, very well sheltered tarmac course using Telford Town Park, and the Silkin Way (a former railway line). 

Entries and info at atwevents (dot) co (dot) uk

title: Worcestershire County XC Championships 2025
description:
2025 Worcestershire County XC Championships
Date is Saturday 13th December, Venue is Warley Woods Smethwick.
Entries are now open for the County XC championships.
Link is: https://entry4sports.co.uk/#/showentries
Closing date for entries is Sunday 23rd November 2025
Entry information and details can be found on the file below.
Worcestershire as hosts, are once again going to be holding a joint Championships with Warwickshire.
Age groups U11 to Seniors.

title: HBXC Winter XC: Race #3
description:
Race #3 of the Winter XC series. Host club is TBD so more information will follow once I know.

The route will be approx. 10km (6 miles) on varying terrain. It should be a good club event and a nice way to meet people and compete against other clubs.

Please click in if you are interested.

title: Saturday Expedition
description:
Meet at the Car park for a 09:00am start. A circular route starting in Winchcombe. About 15km with approximately 450m elevation. 

This is a lovely Cotswold route with ancient burial ground, Roman Villa and Norman Castle (I think) along the way. It has some 'lovely' elevations but we'll tackle these however we feel on the day. 

There's a lovely coffee shop which Sarah A and I rested out so all should be good! 

Train shoes required and bring water and whatever are you nutrition requiements. 
Please click out / keep in touch so that our start is prompt. Thank you. 

LiRF: Julie Slack [Phone Number Redacted]
location: Winchcombe Back Lane Car Park, Back Ln, Cheltenham, GL54 5PZ, United Kingdom

title: Not a run, Take Flight Celebration
description:
This celebration is aimed at anyone who has done Take Flight or who has supported Take Flight. We want to celebrate our new cohort and all the previous ones of whom many have progressed into seasoned runners. 
Or you may be new (or not) to the club and would like to meet some other members. 
The Red Lion has agreed to put on a chilli at a cost of Â£14 per head. 
If you wish to come just for the chilli, please click in here so that I can pass on numbers for food.

I shall then contact you for payment.
Any questions Sarah [Phone Number Redacted]

title: Pre celebration run
description:
This run is aimed at the latest Take Flight cohort, any previous TF cohorts, any supporters and club members. We shall meet at the bandstand in Priory Park and run for 5k taking about 45 minutes, walking/Jeffing up any hills.
High Viz and head/chest torches please.
The run will end at the Red Lion where we shall have chilli and refreshments.
Please click into both events  if you wish to have chilli.
Any questions Sarah [Phone Number Redacted]

title: *League event* HBXC Winter XC: Race #2 Croft Ambrey
description:
Winter XC Race #2 hosted by Croft Ambrey. The race is approx. 10km (6 miles)  in length on varying terrain (mainly off road).

This is also the November Buzzard league race with flat rate points for all participants.

After our success this summer, it would be great to see as many of you clicked in to as many of these as possible, so please get involved. 

More information to follow.

title: Club Photo (NOT A RUN)
description:
Annual club photo in the Rosebank Gardens. 

Timed to allow regular parkrun Buzzards to make their 0900 start. 

Please wear club kit if you have and something pink/blue/white if you don't.

title: WBUH Firewalk **Not A Run**
description:
Final "Elements" event from Worcestershire Breast Unit Haven (WBUH) is a firewalk ðŸ”¥ 

Venue and timings to be confirmed but another placeholder to show which Buzzards will be doing this. 

You will need to book in with WBUH directly. Links will be shared on our other platforms due to Strava's silly ban on them.

Feet of fire ðŸ”¥ make you faster I am told....

title: Monopoly Board, London (Grand Day Out) 16 Miles In 5-6 Hours
description:
Buzzard Grand Day Out to London to run the "Monopoly Board". This is a 16 mile run and we have about 5 -6 hours to do it.
Train leaves GMV about 0900 and gets into PAD about 1130. Return train about 1730 back to Malvern about 2000.

Group travel will be booked if we get more than 10 people. 

Chatty pace to have fun. Multiple run leaders in this so it proves to be a bumper day. 

Hopefully time to get up to the distance bit you could always grab a few "sets" if you want the day out.

Do not pass Go, do not collect Â£200...

Sim Buzzard and Julie Slack
[Phone Number Redacted]

title: *League event* Stroud half marathon and 10k
description:
A new addition to this yearâ€™s league, but their website promises 13.1 miles of fun and frolics!

A lovely progression for anyone running Worcester 10k in September, or if youâ€™re already fit for Worcester half marathon you may as well do this one too.

More information at Stroudhalf(dot)com

title: Buzzard Birthday Non-Darters [NOT A RUN]
description:
Buzzard Birthday social event. Darts tournament.

The winners from each lane will face off in a final at 20:00 to compete for the cash prize (Â£30). Lanes will be drawn randomly.

Should be finished by 20:45.

We will have a separate collection for Worcestershire Breast Unit Haven. 

This event is for non-darts players who want to spectate or come along for drinks or pool or shuffle board etc.

Sim Buzzard 
[Phone Number Redacted]

Dress code: Pink and bling

title: Buzzard Birthday Darters - Flight Club [NOT A RUN]
description:
Buzzard Birthday social event. Darts tournament.

I have hired all six lanes (six to a lane) from 19:00. 

The winners from each lane will face off in a final at 20:00 to compete for the cash prize (Â£30). Lanes will be drawn randomly.

Should be finished by 20:45.

Cost is Â£5 each and includes prize fund money. CASH on the day please 

We will have a separate collection for Worcestershire Breast Unit Haven. 

This event is for darts players. We have 15 so far and hopefully we can get 30 from our 240 members. 

Separate link for non dart players who want to come along for drinks or pool or shuffle board etc.

Sim Buzzard 
[Phone Number Redacted]

Dress code: Pink and bling

title: â€˜League Eventâ€™ Take Flight Graduation Worcester Woods Parkrun
description:
Please come and support us at Worcester Woods Parkrun, when our Take Flight fledglings will graduate by running the 5k. 

League points will be allocated at a flat rate.

I am sure there will be cake at the finish too.

Any questions: Sarah (run leader)
[Phone Number Redacted]

title: Common Cross Country Training
description: Meet under Buzzards. Warm up jog down to Common. Then mix of loops and hill efforts on Comon. All on laps so we keep together at own effort pace and regrouping. Warm downjog to Buzzards by 10am total distance 7 miles max. Off road shoes needed. Andy [Phone Number Redacted]

title: Buzzard Day Social Meet (NOT A RUN)
description:
The Committee decided to move away from the Great Malvern Hotel for Buzzard Day drinks this year and opting for Weavers instead.

Putting this as not a run so those unable to join club runs can click in. 

Sim Buzzard 
Club Chair 
[Phone Number Redacted]

title: Buzzard Day Pilgrimage
description:
To celebrate the club's birthday I am leading a 5k ISH from the Buzzards through town to Buzzard Crescent and back. This has been very social in previous years and hope to repeat that in 2025.

Head torch advised but high Viz essential. 

Aim to complete in about an hour for those who want to go to Weavers for a drink.

We will get obligatory photos at Buzzards and Buzzard crescent.

LiRF: Sim Foreman [Phone Number Redacted]

Click out if you can't make it. Thanks

title: Return of the Ramparts
description: It's back - the popular run around British Camp ramparts.  Roughly 11km - it's not too hilly or challenging.  Please note time change for this week! Contact Andy [Phone Number Redacted]

title: Tuesday 10k
description:
Meet at the corner of Peachfield Road and St Andrew's Road, by the postbox. 

A road run for those who are regularly running upwards of 8k and want to do 10k in 1 1/4 hours. 

Nobody will be left behind and we will walk-run hills as required. 

Hi-Viz and head / chest torches please so that you can be seen and are safe. 

Please click out if you become unable to take part.

LiRF: Julie Slack [Phone Number Redacted]
location: Peachfield Road, Peachfield Road, Malvern, WR14 4AR, United Kingdom

title: BCB - 10k fartlek session (56 minutes)
description:
10k road session to be completed in 56 minutes. 8 minute ish mile running will be interspersed with random efforts of varying distances from 2 lamposts to 2 minutes etc. 

Opportunity to reward yourself with Greggs at the end. 

Lirf: Sim [Phone Number Redacted]

Head torch and hi viz please.

click out if you can't make it.
location: GREGGS, 326 Worcester Road, Malvern, WR14 1BD, United Kingdom

title: Take Flight #6
description:
Take Flight is our couch to 5k equivalent. This is for supporters, for Buzzards wanting to redo the programme or if youâ€™re returning to running and want a gentle reintroduction.
We shall start with a warmup, then some running/walking and then finish with a cooldown/stretch.
We shall stay within the park and so no one will be left behind.
We shall meet at the bandstand.
Any questions: Sarah (run leader) 
[Phone Number Redacted]

title: Sunday Night HM (13 Miles in 1 H 45 M)
description:
Sunday evening HM in time of 1 h 45m. 

High Viz please with head torch optional.

LiRF: Sim Buzzard [Phone Number Redacted]

Please click out if you can't make it.

title: HBXC Winter XC: Race #1
description:
The first race of the Winter Cross Country (XC) series being hosted by Builth. This series consists of 1 race each month from Oct - Feb and will provide some great club competition for runners of all abilities.

After out success with so many people collecting trophies at the Summer series, it would be great to see as many of you click in to the series as possible.

More details about the event will be added to this as they get released. For now, get clicked in.
location: Builth Wells, Builth Wells, Powys, Wales, United Kingdom

title: Sunday Hills
description: There'll be hills - various routes.  10 miles / 16km. Pace between 6 & 7 min km Intermediate level - [Phone Number Redacted]
location: Wyche Cutting, Malvern, WR13 6PJ, United Kingdom

title: 5 on Friday
description:
5k ish run on nearby trails. 
Gentle and chatty with walks up hills as appropriate. 

Route determined as we go along and according to who clicks in. 

Optional post run coffee debrief. 

Please click out if youâ€™re unable to come. 

LiRF: Julie Slack [Phone Number Redacted]

title: Rise & Run
description:
**Rise & Run**

Note: Neil covering for Hannah this week.

Weekly run of approximately 5km on the hills to start your day.

Pace: We will average between 8-9min/km overall. Running the flats/downs, and walking or run/walk the ups.
No one left behind.

Distance: 5km

Time: ~45 minutes

Meeting point: The Buzzards in Rosebank Gardens

Headtorches needed for the start of the run now!

Please remember to click out if you can no longer make it.

Neil
[Phone Number Redacted]

title: Thirsty Thursday - The Bluebell
description:
Fully on the roads now with some footpaths potentially. We will pull a classic route out of the locker this week, there will be ups, downs, and anything in between. 

High Viz and lights essential. 

Distance: 10km
Pace: 5:10-5:30/km

Optional debrief at The Blue Bell after. 

Barbara
[Phone Number Redacted]

title: Thirsty Thursday
description:
5K in approximately 40 minutes. 

There will be street lights for the most part but reflective clothing and or lights advisable. 

No one left behind 

Lirf: Robyn [Phone Number Redacted]

title: Thursday Hills
description:
Thursday Hills 7/8km on the hills in 1hours/1 hour 10 mins 
Social run - whether itâ€™s your chatty run pace or pushy pace you will be supported by the group or support others. 
30:30 (run/walk) on hills to keep momentum and keep together. 
trail shoes needed 
Headtorch needed 
Route changes weekly
Always start at Wyche cutting bus stop 

Lily - [Phone Number Redacted]
